instructionsBeginners: Lie flat on bench with eyes directly under the bar
Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder width with palms facing forward
Unrack the bar with straight arms and position it over your mid-chest
Lower the bar with control to your mid-chest, keeping elbows at 45-degree angle
Press the bar back up to the starting position until arms are fully extended
Maintain 5-point contact (head, shoulders, glutes on bench; feet flat on floor) throughout
coachingPoints: Maintain scapular retraction (shoulder blades squeezed together) throughout the entire movement
Initiate the press with leg drive through the floor for maximum power transfer
Bar path should be slightly diagonal toward your face, not perfectly vertical
Control the eccentric (lowering) phase for 2-3 seconds to maximize muscle tension
Keep wrists stacked directly over elbows to prevent wrist strain and maintain optimal force transfer
scientificReference: Lehman GJ (2005). The influence of grip width and forearm pronation/supination on upper-body myoelectric activity during the flat bench press. J Strength Cond Res 19(3):587-591
